intro: Psychotria tabacifolia, commonly known as the tobacco leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that resemble those of the tobacco plant, hence its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Psychotria tabacifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
